"I don't know." Nikki answered. "I'm not sure if I really needed to go there. I mean my mother did't tell me. Perhaps it was a Nikki from another class."

"Well every kid needs to go to the school nurse once a year. But mostly they do it alphabetical." Denvert said calmly

"What did the doctor said about your weight?" Rue asked curious.

"What about that? I'm perfectly healthy." Nikki said.

"Did he told you that?" Rue asked clearly. "Did he really said: 'You're are healthy'? Or did you just assume you're healthy?"

Nikki looked at Rue not really understanding what she mend. But now she thought about it she realized the doctor did't said she was healthy. She just assumed she was healthy. He did't told her she was healthy but he did't told her she was unhealthy. She looked at Rue who looked a bit worried at her.

"Well he did't said I was healthy but he did't said I was unhealthy so I guess... "

"Nikki I don't think he thought you were healthy. I've been to several doctors and mostly they had something bad to say about my weight. My sister had the same problem. You are way fatter then me or my sister at your age, so I can't believe he thought you were healthy at you're weight. Perhaps you're healthy. I mean those doctor's only see numbers. They don't know how healthy you are. They only believe the numbers. If they say you're unhealthy they believe that. If they say you're not they believe you're not healthy. I don't think he thought you were healthy since your weight is much higher then average."

Nikki looked at her new friend. She liked Rue. She did't really liked what she was saying now but at the other hand she might be right. What she said did make sense. Perhaps she was right and did the doctor really thought she was unhealthy. Now she thought about it every time she told him she was healthy he more or less avoid the answer.
Nikki swallowed worried.

"Do you really think he thought I was unhealthy?" Nikki asked worried.

"I can't believe he thinks you're healthy. Sorry Nikki."

"So... now what?" Nikki asked.

"Well I guess he want to have a talk with your mother. But like Denvert said: Every kid has once a year a check up by the school doctor. You also go to the school doctor if you feel sick or are injured but... you also needs to go if one of your parents make a appointment for you. Would you mother make a appointment for you because she think you're too fat?"

1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.title: Healthy or unhealthy?

choices: She wakes up back in the nurses office.
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.content:
After a while, Mrs Tatcher clapped her hands for the class' attention.
"Okay everyone, sit down in your seats, I'm going to bring round some maths problems for you to try and solve."
Nikki made her way over to her seat and slowly lowered herself onto it, feeling her buttocks droop over each side. Mrs Tatcher had tried to get her a larger chair to sit on, but it was school policy that all pupils had the same equipment and it hadn't been allowed, so she'd just have to deal with the normal chairs.
When the worksheet arrived, passed over to her by Tanja, Nikki leant forwards and squinted at it. Adding big numbers to little numbers; 3+7. She considered the question. Maybe... 6? She liked 6.
With an effort she reached forwards and picked up her pencil, quickly scribbled a wonky 6 on the paper, then sat back with a groan. Because of her huge stomach, she had to sit quite a way back from the desk, and reaching the tabletop with her short arms was quite a challenge. She took a few more deep breaths, then leant forwards again. 2+6. Was that 8? Or 9? Sitting back again, she looked around the classroom, already bored with maths.
Out the window, she could see other kids running around in their PE kits, playing games whilst their teachers watched. She didn’t understand what they liked about exercise; she’d never done any herself, and it looked tiring. Then again, they were all laughing together, and it looked like they were having fun… the only times she felt as happy as they looked was when she was eating.
On the subject of eating, there was a sudden ringing sound as the bell went for lunch. Mrs Tatcher looked up, surprised.
“Oh, is it that late already? Leave your worksheets on the table, and you can go outside for lunch.”
Nikki grinned. Finally! A meal would take her mind off the unexpected appointment. She was having a cooked school lunch today, which was quite rare. Heaving herself to her feet, she waddled as fast as she could towards the canteen, completely forgetting to wait for her friends or even grab her coat. Despite her head start, however, she was still nearly last in line to be served, as the older and slimmer kids streamed around her like water around a rock, speeding into a disorderly line in front of her. By the time she’d puffed her way into the queue, she was panting for breath and starving hungry, but at least ten minutes from being served.
By the time she got to the front, her knees were aching and she was utterly ravenous.
“Extra of everything!” she demanded of the serving lady. The slim woman looked at her tiredly.
“Magic word?” she asked, tonelessly.
“Please! Extra of everything please!”
She was quickly served large portions of French fries, beans and sausages, and though far less than what she’d have at home she hurried to a table without so much as a thank you, sitting down on a bench. The wood creaked ominously beneath her, but she was too hungry to even notice as she grabbed a handful of fries, stuffing them into her waiting mouth. She stabbed a sausage with a plastic fork, shoving the whole thing in her mouth at once and chewing on the scalding hot meat. In less than five minutes, she had finished eating, but though her stomach was swollen and full, she was still hungry for more.
Picking up her tray again, she heaved herself out of her chair, almost slipping on the polished wooden floor, before heaving her heavy body back towards the remnants of the queue.
“Can I have some more… please?” she asked, recognising the tired server from before. The woman squinted at her.
“Well… seeing as you asked nicely, I suppose.” She doled out another portion onto Nikki’s plate, sending her rushing back to her seat to eat her new meal. Despite the fact she’d already eaten the equivalent of three normal meals, she didn’t even slow down as she practically poured the fast food down her throat. Finally she lurched a final time to her feet and put her tray away. Though she could have still eaten more, she knew from experience that the serving ladies would never give her more than two servings.
She was tired now, the food in her bloated belly making her sleepy. She stumbled out of the dining hall and into the play room, quickly collapsing onto a chair in the corner, sitting awkwardly to accommodate for her overstuffed gut. Maybe just a five minute nap, she thought. Just five minutes…
///////
“Nikki? Nikki?” the words permeated her hazy dreams of food, dragging her reluctantly back to the real world. At a third “Nikki!” she opened her eyes. Mrs Tatcher was staring at her, hands on hips.
“I’ve been looking for you everywhere, young lady! Classes are about to start, and everyone’s waiting on you!”
She mumbled a vague apology, attempted to get to her feet, then sat down again suddenly. Her belly was still swollen from lunch, but it was rumbling hungrily again now.
Mrs Tatcher grabbed her under the arms, and with a heave, lifted her to her feet.
“Now come on!” she said, hurrying back towards the classroom. Nikki followed reluctantly, moving at a snails pace, but soon they were back at class. Everyone looked at her as she walked in the door, pinning her down with her eyes.
“Where’ve you been?” whispered Tanja questioningly.
“Fell asleep…” She mumbled in reply, shuffling towards her seat. After what seemed like an hour, she reached her chair and sat down on it heavily.
Then, several things happened at once. She was aware of a loud cracking sound, then suddenly she was falling backwards, but before she could so much as move a finger something slammed into the back of her head and suddenly…
Darkness and dreams.
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.title: Darkness and Dreams.

choices: Help Nikki lose weight and get healthier
Decide happiness is more important than health
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.content:
Strange floating patterns swirled before her eyes, before finally coalescing into... Mr Ragni? He was shining a little light into her eye, and she blinked.
"Nikki?" he called. "Can you hear me?"
She blinked a few more times, then groaned.
"Owwwww. My head hurts!" she complained tearfully.
"That's okay," he said, "You've had quite a fall. We've telephoned your mom, she should be here in a few minutes to pick you up. Okay?"
"Okay..." there was a pulsing ache in the back of her head, beating in time with her overgrown heart. "What happened?" she asked.
"Well, ah, it would seem that when you sat down, the back legs of the chair snapped off and you banged your head on the radiator. Luckily, Mrs Tatcher, Mrs Lowe and Mr Carrow were able to carry you to me. I've had a look; you seem to be okay, so you can go home with your mom when she arrives."
Nikki lay on the examining table, and though her head was painful, she actually felt quite comfortable. There was a soft pillow behind her head, and she was still tired from lunch. By the time she drifted off to sleep yet again, she could barely even feel the pain in her head.
///////
"Nikki! Are you alright?!" Her mom was standing at the side of the table, a scared expression on her narrow face.
"Huh? Yeah..." said the young girl drowsily. "One more minute..."
"Come on Nikki, we're going home right now." Linda insisted, but suddenly Mr Ragni had taken her by the arm.
"Actually, Mrs Glemcer, can I have a word with you?" he asked, leading her away to the other side of the room. Nikki didn't really care; she was far too tired. She caught a few words of their conversation, though she didn't know what any of them meant. "Morbidly obese", "future heart problems" and "diabetes" were all words she heard thrown around, but they made about as much sense as Greek would have to her young ears.
Eventually, Linda came back over.
"We're leaving now Nikki," she said, her voice shaky. There were tears on her cheeks. "Come on."
Reluctantly, Nikki heaved herself off the table and followed her mother, whining about how much her head hurt. They were soon outside as Nikki stumbled along slowly with Linda rushing ahead, drying her eyes on a tissue she'd produced from somewhere. Half way to the car, the young girl sat down for a rest on the wall. She was shaking off the last vestiges of sleep now and her head was hurting more again, now matching the near-omnipresent ache in her knees. Eventually, she caught her breath as well as she ever did nowadays, and waddled to the car where her mother was standing, gazing at her daughter as if she was an alien.
"Mom?" she asked unsurely, and at the sound of her voice Linda seemed to remember who she was.
"Oh, yes." she opened the door to the car and, with a great effort and some pulling from Nikki, managed to heave her huge daughter into the car. She was a strong woman, but just getting Nikki into the car was an ordeal that left both of them panting for breath. Nikki shuffled across to the middle seat, the only one where she could sit comfortably, and strapped the seatbelt across her flabby belly. She should really be sitting in a car seat, but she had long ago grown too large for even the very biggest on sale. The sides dug into her soft flesh and the plastic creaked whenever she moved. Never particularly careful, Linda had determined that the best option was just to not use one at all.
They quickly accelerated away from the school, heading for home. As they sped through the empty streets, Nikki spoke.
“Mom, did you book me to see Mr Ragni?”
“Not now Nikki.” Said Linda, voice slightly shaky.
“Why didn’t you tell me I was going to see him?”
“Nikki! Not- not now. We can have this conversation when we’re back home, but for now, please shut up!” As soon as she’d said it she felt bad, but she just could not cope with her daughter getting all ‘moral high ground’ on her at that moment. Back at the school, Mr Ragni had told her of the results of his examination, and… oh, God.
She knew Nikki was overweight, obese even, but according to the knowledgeable nurse, she was far beyond even those classifications. She was, in his words, “Perilously large”. Apparently, she was now at risk of a whole host of things she hadn't even recognized the names of. He had then instructed her that she should put her daughter on a strict diet and exercise plan- or risk losing her altogether.
She glanced at her daughter through the rear view mirror and sighed, quickly wiping her eyes again with a tissue. She knew how much her daughter loathed exercise, and how important food was to her.
It was time to make a difficult decision.
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.title: She wakes up back in the nurses office.

choices: Nikki is to upset to look at the list
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.content:
Nikki looked at her mother. She did't really understood what was going on. Since she had been only child her parents normally always had time for her but now her mother did't seem to have time for her. But since it seemed it had something to do with her she thought she had the right to know.

"Mommy, what's going on? Why are you so sad? Is it about my head? Sure it hurts, but I don't think I'm in any real danger."

"I said we would talk about this later." Linda said between tears.

Nikki leaned back. She wondered what was going on. She thought it might have something to do with the check up. But according to the doctor from plus size models she had been healthy. So would this doctor think something else. However Rue said that the she could't believe that the doctor thought she was healthy. Perhaps that girl had been right the entire time.
But since her mother did't seem to wanna talk about it she waited. Linda said she would talk about it to her at home.
A few minutes later they were at home. With some effort of Linda Nikki could get out of the car and waddle inside. She waddled to the couch and was glad she could sit and catch her breath.
Linda went sitting next to her and looked at her obese daughter. When Nikki's breathing finally got normal again she looked at her mother.

"Did you make that appointment for me and did't tell me about it?" Nikki asked.

"Yeah I did Nikki. I just did't want a discussion about it. Besides it was't my idea. Your teacher came with the idea. I just did't wanna go though all that stuff with you again. But I'm more worried about what the doctor told me."

"I really don't think the injury is fatal. My head hurts but..."

"I'm not talking about that. However I rather that you stay at home for two days. But that's not all. The doctor gave you a check up. Even he was shocked about your weight, and he had seen some pretty overweight kids in his life."

"So I'm a bit overweight?" Nikki asked not really impressed.

"No Nikki, you're not, you're way beyond overweight. He told me he never saw any other kid so overweight and more out of shape then you. I got a list with risks you can have in the future longer then the list of times we argued about your weight. He was really worried about your health Nikki and honestly I am too. But you knew that. I never really liked it you were so fat but lately it's really starting to become a problem. I see you're getting tired from walking even short distances. You're getting teased, and I knew that was gonna happen. Nikki you can't go on like this. You need to go on a strict... a strict diet."

"What? No! No please anything but that! I hate dieting! Besides I need to be fat to be a plus size model!"

"Nikki even if you would lose 200 pounds you will still be fat enough to be a plus size model. I'm afraid you never get slim but I wanna get you at least on a weight without having to worry about any health risks. I'm sorry Nikki but you're in serious danger of health risks. Besides I heard you broke a chair today."

"T... that... was... a... ac... ac... accident." Nikki said between tears. "He... broke... under... my... my weight."

"See. That's one of the problem's of being so overweight. So Nikki I know you won't like it but you're going on a diet and that's final."

Nikki now really started to cry long and loud. She could't deal with a diet. It sounded to her like a fate worse then dead.

"Now Nikki to help you lose weight you can go on a activity group. I have a whole list of activities here you can choose from. Perhaps you can do something with your friends. How does that sound?"
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.title: Fate worse then dead

choices: Nikki gets hungry, tries to sneak a snack.
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.content:
Linda tried to show her the list, but the young girl smacked it away with one plump hand, sending the piece of paper fluttering to the cream carpet. Tears still streaming down her face, she turned and blundered through the doorway and up the stairs towards her room. Moving faster than Linda had seen her move since... well, ever, she practically ran into her bedroom and slammed the door, her wailing sob suddenly muffled by the thick wood.
Linda wiped her eyes on yet another tissue, trying to work out what to do. Nikki would need some time to calm down, she always did after a tantrum, but she'd never seemed quite so upset before...
She groaned, holding her head in her hands. As if it wasn't difficult enough to accept how badly she'd failed with her daughter's health, now Nikki was making it hard for her when she tried to fix her mistakes! So many hours spent trying to be a good parent, trying to teach ABC's and numbers and seasons and countless other things, and at the end of it, the damn girl got upset when she tried to literally save her life! She'd poured so much love into her, and this is what she got back...
And then, in a sudden burst of glorious enlightenment, she realized what she had to do. Perhaps... just perhaps... it was because she'd tried too hard; been too soft, and caused her daughter to become soft herself. Perhaps if she was firm, Nikki could firm up too? It was worth a try, God only knew she'd given everything else a go.
Pulling out her laptop, she opened up Excel and began quickly drawing up timelines and tables, graphs and schedules. Working at the sort of speed only a woman trained eight years as a secretary can, she had soon finished a multitude of documents, her daughter's future now in the form of a dozen charts. Hand shaking every so slightly, she clicked print, and listened as the computer in the next room began inking Nikki's life for the next few years.
The time for apathy had passed; the obese girl was overdue a proper lifestyle, and Linda had taken it upon herself to enforce it.
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.title: Charts and Tribulations

1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.content:
Nikki slammed the door and threw herself on the bed, gasping in great gulps of breath even as the tears poured down her face. That was the first time in months she'd climbed all the stairs without taking a break, and now her knees and chest hurt again as well as her head. She lay face down on the cotton sheets, sobbing into the pink covers and wishing her mom could just understand and let her be. She wasn't that fat! Maybe Mr Ragni had made up the things he'd told her mom to get revenge for breaking the chair...
Eventually, she heaved herself out of the bed and waddled over to the window, leaning against the sill. It had started raining, fat drops splashing against the gravel path outside and dripping off green leaves. Before she could properly take in the unaccustomed sight, however, the window began to steam up from her breath, irregular from the walk over. Perhaps it would be nice to be able to move around without getting so out of breath, or even go outside occasionally...
Suddenly, her stomach started rumbling. It had been hours now since she'd eaten at school, and she was used to eating every half hour or so when at home. Perhaps she still had some candies under her bed? She sank to her hands and knees, clumsily shuffling through the mound of wrappers that had built up over the last few months, but had no luck. She'd have to go downstairs to find something to eat.
She opened her door as stealthily as she could and sneaked into the corridor, glancing around for any sign of her mother. Nowhere in sight. She began climbing down the stairs, wincing as every step creaked and groaned under her impressive weight. Half way down she stopped briefly to catch her breath, before hurrying down the last few stairs and heading for the kitchen. She glanced up as she waddled towards the doorway, and froze. Linda was standing, arms folded, face resolute, in the entrance to the kitchen.
"Uh, hello..." she said, trying to assemble her round face to look as guiltless as possible. "Can I have a- uh, a snack?"
"No."
"But I'm hungry..." she whined loudly, and was surprised when her mom's face didn't even change.
"Good. Perhaps you'll lose some of that weight."
"But- but mom, I'm hungry!" Spluttered Nikki. She was used to being able to change her mother's mind with ease, just by whining a bit and pouting, but today Linda's face was resolute.
"No food until dinner, and that's final." She said firmly, and Nikki gasped, tears once again welling in the corners of her eyes.
"But that's hours away!"
"Four hours."
"I'll starve if you don't give me food!" Said Nikki, and Linda smiled thinly.
"I think starving is the one thing you don't have to worry about, young lady. You can go outside, or you can play in your room. No TV except on weekends from now on."
The corpulent young girl could only stare, shocked. She'd always been able to watch as much TV as she wanted, always been allowed to eat what she wanted... she'd never had restrictions before at all. Now, suddenly, her comfortable life was crashing down around her head. Not even really processing the conversation they'd just had, Nikki stumbled slowly back towards her bedroom, and once more collapsed onto her bed.
The tears were streaming freely once again, but this time they was silent, aside from her heavy, ragged breathing.
At least dinner was going to be big... right?
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.title: Stone Cold.

1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.content:
After some time Nikki was cried dry. She could't cry anymore. She could't remember she ever felt so sad. Not even that time when she broke her arm two years ago. At least everyone then wanted to help her and do things for her. But this sounded to her like the most cruel thing ever. No more food. No more T.V on top of all that. After eating watching T.V was her biggest hobby. She also liked books but the trouble was she could't read yet. Just a few words. She did't thought her mother would read her a story. But perhaps her father, if he got home.
She went sitting on the floor on her fat but. She decided to play a bit with some of her toys. She need to wait for four hours anyway. She would like to sneak into the kitchen but knew her mother would guard the kitchen, and to get to the pantry she need to go through the kitchen. There was no where else food in the house.
She need to keep herself occupied for four whole hours. She reached for her box of toys. She turned it upside down and looked for some dolls or other toys to play with. When she found some she noticed how much room in front of her was occupied by her belly She really need to stretch her arms out. She started to play but she could't really keep her mind to it. Every time her mind drifted of to her true love... food. Finally she threw the barbie doll against the wall.

"This is stupid. Besides that doll is way to skinny."

She crawled over to the doll noticing that when she crawled her belly dragged over the floor. She liked that feeling. She picked up the barbie doll and pushed on her belly. Her belly was very flat. There hardly was any belly. All those barbie dolls in every commercial was as flat if a surfboard. While if Nikki looked around in the town or at the playground or in the swimming pool she saw a lot of fat and obese persons. Sure there were also enough skinny persons, but still. It was't really realistic. Did her mother want her to look like this? If she carefully looked at it she thought that it was impossible to have such a body. Besides how where you able to have a baby with such a tiny waist. If her belly was about eight months pregnant she would break in half.

"Stupid doll. Is this how girls need to look like. I rather be fat. I like it." She said while she threw the doll away again.

It was true she liked being fat. She admitted that she did't liked that she got out of breath so fast. At the other hand she did't liked moving. The only reason she did move was because she needed to. If somebody would carry her she would have liked it. But no one was able to carry her. Not even her parents were able to carry her. Her father had been able to carry her some years ago but even then it was kind of difficult.

"Why did my mother has to be so worried about my weight? I wish I had a mother who did't cared about my weight! Who just wanted me to be happy! I can't help it I never feel full."

She rolled on her belly and saw her barbie doll.

"I hate you. You give girls the idea you need to be a toothpick girl with the waist of a insect."

Suddenly she smiled. She picked up different toys of her and put them on her desk. She picked some paper and pencils and started to draw the faces of her toys but instead of the tiny waists some of her toys had she drew them fat. With big bellies, rubbing thighs, bowl cheeks and flabby arms. She just need to look in the mirror to see how a fat person looked. She must admit she liked doing this. True she was still hungry and did't liked that but at least this kept her occupied until it was time for dinner.
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.title: Barbie

1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.content:
Eventually, though, she got tired of her crude doodles and began looking around her room again for anything to do. However, her room was quite bare. Unlike most other kids her age, she didn't have many toys; she'd always preferred to just watch TV or eat something instead playing with dolls or making things, and now when she couldn't do either she didn't know what to do.
After a few minutes of sitting bored, she noticed her wardrobe. That was it; she could play dress-up! She waddled over to the closet and pulled open the door, then dragged a few outfits out onto the carpet and began getting undressed. However, she soon ran into a problem. Normally, her mom or dad helped her with changing clothes, and on her own she was having difficulty. She was barely able to reach around her oversized belly to reach the waistband of her pants, never mind actually undoing the button and taking them off. She couldn't even get her shirt off on her own.
Depressed, defeated and out of breath, she lay back down on her bed with a groan. 'It's not like the clothes would have fitted you anyway', pointed out a voice in her head snidely.
"Shut up." She said out loud, then immediately felt a bit stupid; only a few hours without food and she was already starting to talk to herself. Not that she had anyone else to talk to; she was too angry at her mom to try and talk to her, and her dad wasn't home yet. She wondered how long it was until dinner now. She had a big clock on the wall, but she couldn't read it, and she didn't know how long she'd been drawing and playing for.
Lying on her bed, she was beginning to feel tired again, as she usually did after doing anything nowadays. Despite how long she'd already spent asleep that day, her eyes became very heavy as her body decided it needed a rest.
At least her head didn't hurt so much now, she thought as she drifted away into sleep. Always stay positive...
///////////
"Nikki!" Linda called up the stairs. "Time for dinner!"
Instantly she was wide awake, and before she was even aware of where she was she was halfway down the stairs, belly rumbling loudly and constantly. Stumbling down the last steps, she waddled as fast as she could into the kitchen and all the way to her seat, collapsing into the chair even as the wood groaned ominously under her wide rear.
Stony-faced, Linda placed a small starter in front of Nikki, then watched as the young girl shoved it into her mouth and swallowed once, finishing the plate in less than five seconds.
"What'smaincourse?" She asked in a rush.
"That was the main course." Said Linda, taking back the plate and going back to the sink to wash it up.
"What?" Nikki stared at her blankly.
"I said, that was the main course."
Nikki half smiled, waiting for her mom to reveal the joke, to pull out a big bowl of pasta, or meat, or anything. She'd eaten that starter so quickly she didn't even know what it had been, and her stomach was rumbling so loudly the neighbors probably thought a plane was going overhead.
"I don't know why you're smiling, Nikki, this diet is no joke." Linda said icily, and the 5 year old's smile dropped from her face like a wet bar of soap from the hand.
Suddenly, there was a loud creaking of wood as she slumped back in her chair, and her mom lurched forwards. Linda's icy mask broke, worry sprawling across her face as Nikki's eyes rolled back in her head, showing the whites of her eyes.
She needn't have worried too much though; At the thought of meals being like this forever, the girl had just fainted dead away.
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.title: "Main" course.

choices: Tomorrow morning breakfast (two slices rye bread with cheese and ham)
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.content:
"Nikki? Are you all right? Come on it's not that bad. Nikki."

Then she heard the front door open and close and suddenly Bram came in with a worried look at his face. Then he saw Linda and Nikki passed out in her chair.

"What's going om here?"He asked looking at Nikki and Linda.

"Well I'm not sure." Linda said. "I made a appointment to send Nikki to the school doctor. Well he said Nikki was morbidly obese, what was't really a surprise and put her on a diet. I also forbid her to watch T.V except during weekends. I also want her to do some sort of exercise. She did't want to choose herself so perhaps I can pick one for her. Well after dinner I told her that what she ate in five seconds was the main course she just passed out. I don't know why.

"What about that bandage around her head?" He asked.

"Oh yeah she fell at school and hurt her head. But that had nothing to do with it."

"Honey are you really sure this is the right way. I admit Nikki is too heavy for her age, and I know it's unhealthy, but forbid her to watch T.V. I understand you don't want her too watch too much T.V but can you just say... only watch a half hour each day instead of no T.V at all. Also putting her on a crash diet. How much food did she get?"

After Linda told her how much or more how less food Nikki got he put on big eyes.

"That's all she got?" He asked in disbelief. "Listen I understand you want her to lose weight, I do to, but putting on such a strict diet. I don't think that's good for her. Crash diets are only good for adults. There's also the part she does't wanna lose weight so she has no will power to eat less. At least give her some more fruit and vegetables. They have't that much calories."

Linda looked with a irritated face at her husband. She was't fully agreeing with him. At the other hand he did sound reasonable with just a half hour T.V a day and giving Nikki some more fruit and vegetables. Perhaps Nikki would't make such a big drama about it. Well she would probably make a drama about it anyway but hopefully she would't faint.

"I also think we need to follow the diet too." He said.

"What? You can't be serious. I'm not fat."

"She doe's have much will power. How do you want to motivate her if you can eat delicious things like meat, gravy and fries while she only can have a small amount. You want her to lose weight. You making it easier if we too follow the diet. That's fair. Else she sees us eating things she cant have. That's just teasing her."

"I know. You're right. But it's not fair to him... her... it... to our child." She said and patted her bulging belly. "If I need to follow a diet while being pregnant... do you think that's good for the child?"

"True... but then eat food when Nikki is at school or in bed. At least so she can't see it."

"I can do that."

Slowly they heard a mumbling sound at Nikki got up. After a few seconds she remembered what happened and looked with a terrified look at her parents.

"Nikki," Bram started. "I talked with your mother and..."

"You can't put me on this diet! I starve! I just had a main course that was smaller then a appetizer!"

"Nikki calm down. Let me finish. You're allowed to watch T.V A half hour a day. I also talked about your portions. Well they will get a bit bigger but mostly with vegetables and fruit, and to make it easier for you we will also follow the diet. I also have you rather stay at home tomorrow." Looking at her bandage.

"So can I have some more food now?" Nikki asked.

"Fine I will make some fruit for you." Linda said and sighed. "And you can thank you father for all those things."

Nikki still did't agree with the diet but she was wise enough to did't push her luck now. She needed to think of something. But what?
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.title: Add water by the wine

1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.content:
The following weeks had been utter hell for Nikki. Her meals were far too small, mom was extremely strict, and her dad was of no help at all. She had tried talking, reasoning, even begging for them to stop making her diet. She felt as if there were shackles around her. The only time she saw her friends was at school. Her mom wouldn't let her play with them at all. Unsure of what to do, Nikki fell into a depression.

         "I can't keep doing this. First the diet now, I can't see my friends. Mom pulled me from plus sized modeling. What else is she going to take from me?" Nikki sobbed into her pillow. She was in her room which is where she always went to after school. Nikki looked at a crude drawing of her mother. She had made it just before her diet had started. She didn't understand why her mom changed so suddenly. Maybe this was her moms plan all along. It had to be. At least that's what Nikki's logic was. Her mom was jealous of Nikki. Nikki was fat and happy. Her mom was skinny and grumpy all the time. Nikki grabbed the drawing and promptly ripped it apart. Seething with anger, she stomped on the remains as hard as she could which was pretty difficult for her since her belly was all she could see when looking down.

         "That....will...teach..you." Nikki said between heavy breaths.

         "Nikki, its weigh in day. Get over here right now!" Linda shouted from the bathroom.

         Nikki waddled her way out of her room. She hatted this day of the week most, Friday. Friday was when she stood on a scale and wait for her mom to pass judgement. Last week Nikki didn't loose any weight which made Linda furious. "This week will probably be no different." Nikki thought. She hobbled onto the scale and after a few seconds it showed her weight. Nikki had no lost any weight at all. In fact, she gained one pound.

         "How is that possible! 283 pounds! You gained weight, Nikki! Who gave you food? Was it those friends of yours?" Linda asked with an angry tone.

         "No they didn't! I only ate what you put in my lunchbox." Nikki replied. Which was a lie, Danvert, Nicole, and Tanja had been giving their lunches to Nikki everyday.

         "I don't want to hear your lies. Go to your room. No dinner for you tonight."

         "Why do you hate me so much?" Nikki whispered

         "To you room, now!" yelled Linda.

         Nikki waddled away leaving Linda standing in the bathroom. Once Linda heard the door to Nikki's room shut, she began to silently cry. "I don't hate you, Nikki. I just can't get you to see what you are doing to yourself." After recomposing herself, Linda walked to the kitchen to prepare dinner.
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.title: Over the next few weeks...

choices: Nikki put's her plan into action
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.content:
The past weeks had been the worst weeks of Nikki's entire short life. She did't want to be on a diet and eat small meals that she could eat in a few seconds. She wanted to eat. No, not really eat, she wanted to pig out. Stuff her face. Wolfing down a mountain of food. She felt like she could eat a horse. Literally. Well her mother did let her eat some fruit ever now and then. It was't much... but better then nothing. She was happy her father had done at least something for her.

"I really need more food." Nikki whined.

The problem was, there was only food in the fridge, the freezer, the cupboard and in the pantry. The fridge, freezer and cupboard were all in the kitchen and the only way too the pantry was through the kitchen but Linda was guarded the kitchen like a tiger. She even put a lock on the pantry. Besides, even if she was able to get something to eat her mother would find it out. She always knew it if some food was missing.
Her mothers baby bump got bigger each week. She wondered if her mother followed the diet. Sure she followed the diet around her but further. It did't really mind. t did't changed anything for her. Her mother was thin so she did't need to diet.

"Rue had been right the entire time. She knew the doctor did't thought I was healthy. Well doctor's had probably said the same to her many times. I wish her sister could take me home. She would feed me. Or Tina, she would feed me too. But my mother don't let me see my friends or Tina. Just because she thinks they feed me... what they probably will do now I'm saying this."

Nikki knew that there was't a way to get the food inside the house. So if she wanted food then she need to get food outside. Point is, Linda kept a eye on her the entire time. Climbing out of the window was impossible for a girl of her size. Why did she have Linda for a mother. Why not Denvert's mother or Tina.

"But there must be a way. Tina would take food to me... but my mother is watching me every hour of the day... wait a second. Maybe Tina can bring me food during the night! Perhaps Rue's sister can help her. I need to wait until my parent are asleep. I just need to call Rue and Tina tomorrow. Rue can ask her sister if she can help Tina get some food to me when it's night. Then I can pig out."

She started to smile. Something she had't done for some time now. Why did't she thought of this before. She knew Linda would be furious the next weigh in moment but that was worth it and perhaps Linda would give up. She doubted it but... who knew.

"Yes. I did come on with a plan. But I need to be patient."

She took some paper and some pencils, since she could't read yet, could only watch a half hour T.V each day, and was't allowed to eat much food Nikki started to draw to kill time. She got pretty good. She still liked drawing heads of toys and cartoon figures on fat bodies and she got better at it each day. Her belly rumbled but hopefully she could change that soon.
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.title: Nikki's plan

choices: Nikki eats and eats and eats...
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.content:
Linda was at a crossroads. There was no doubt a diet and exercise plan would be beneficial to Nikki, considering her immense size and ravenous appetite. But at the same time, she couldn't just cut her favourite thing out of her life; it would devastate her! And forcing her into exercise would just do more harm than good, considering she got winded from climbing the stairs at home. Granted, helping her lose weight would stop that, but she couldn't just throw it on her. She's only five after all!
Besides, she figured internally, her obese offspring hadn't shown any health problems. Nothing too serious anyway, just laziness and difficulty to find clothes her size. She never once said anything about chest pains or anything of the sort her whole life, just either that she was tired or she was hungry.

With a shrug, Linda decided to not worry about putting her globular girl on a diet. At least not yet; she was only young, and had all the time in the world to diet. Until something serious happened to her, she could let her eat all she likes.

However, she did begin to feel a guilt rising within her; she'd yelled at her own daughter to shut up, and for no good reason. Time to remedy that.
"Are you alright sweetie?" She asked softly, keeping her eyes on the road, "How's your head now?"
"Still hurts a bit," Nikki mumbled, eyes blinking tiredly. She must've just been about to settle down for a nap.
Linda let out a sigh. "Nikki, I'm sorry for snapping at you. Mommy just had a lot to think about and didn't mean to yell."
"That's okay," the porky girl nodded slowly, "you didn't look so good when you came outta the doctor's office. Did you get sick?"
"No, no," her mother chuckled, shaking her head, "He was just telling me to make sure you're safe."

A grin appeared on Linda's face as an idea came to her. "I know what'll cheer you right up; some ice cream and a good rest on the sofa!"
Nikki gasped, the drowsiness in her eyes replaced by a look of pure surprise. "You mean it?!"
"Of course sweetheart," Linda nodded, sounding as sincere as possible, "you had a bad fall, so you need to take it easy until you're better!"
A huge smile broke across Nikki's face, pushing her cheeks over her eyes a bit, and her large legs kicked in a new-found excitement. Her stomach sounding its approval in the form of a loud grumble.


Soon enough, Linda parked the car into the driveway and heaved Nikki out of her seat. She watched adoringly as her dumpy daughter waddled ahead of her toward the door, bouncing on her toes by the door and causing her large belly to bounce up and down with her.
"Alright, alright," she chuckled, unlocking the door and pushing it open. She followed Nikki inside as she made a slow beeline for the living room, getting a helpful push from her mother onto the sofa after a few unsuccessful attempts to raise her leg up onto it.

"Now then sweetie, what kind of ice cream would you like?" Linda asked, kneeled down and setting Nikki into a laying position, propping a pillow behind her sore head head on the armrest.
"Ummm...chocolate," Nikki decided, then shook her head, "wait, strawberry...no, vanilla. Wait, chocolate! Um..."
Her mother could only smile. "How about all of them?"
"Oooh," the greedy girl smiled, then gave a frantic nod, "yes please!"

Linda stood back up and flicked on the TV to Nikki's favourite channel before heading into the kitchen with Nikki's order. She didn't feel bad about this at all; Nikki was happy, so she was happy. The way she saw it, she was her daughter, so why not let her eat to her sweet little heart's content? Mother knows best, after all.


The doting mother looked at Nikki's sweet request; a bowl of ice cream, housing one scoop of vanilla, chocolate, and strawberry each. A colourful plastic spoon sat next to it.
It was perfect...but it needed something. Something to cheer her right up after a particularly bad day.
Linda took a glance up to the clock, and decided she could give her just a little bit more to eat, just for today.

She grabbed a few bottles of toppings from the cupboard, squirting strawberry sauce on the vanilla scoop, mint on the strawberry, and of course, chocolate on the chocolate scoop. Her dear girl loved chocolate a lot, so she'd definitely love this.
She put the bottles back, and reached into another cupboard to grab one of Nikki's favourite chocolate bars from a multi-pack.
Next was a large glass, filled up to the brim with chocolate milk.

Setting it all on a tray, Linda carried the unhealthy meal into the living room. Nikki's face broke into a wide grin as she sat up, and Linda set the tray on her lap.
"There you are, my little princess," she cooed, pecking her on the plushy cheek, "that should hold you until dinner."
"Thanks mommy!" Nikki squealed, licking her lips greedily before digging in to her treats.
"You're very welcome," Linda stood back up, giving her daughter's soft brown hair a stroke, "just ask if you need more."

And with that, she withdrew upstairs and left the portly girl to her gorging.
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.title: Decide happiness is more important than health

choices: Fast forward to the photo shoot
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.content:
Nikki happy started eating her ice cream like if she had't eaten in days. The ice cream tasted terrific. Especially with all the toppings. She was eating so fast she almost swallowed her spoon. Soon the entire ice cream disappeared in Nikki's huge pouch and she belched loudly and leaned back and reached for the chocolate bar which she stuffed in her mouth in just a few bites. A few gulps and belch later and the chocolate bar was gone. The only thing remained was the glass of chocolate milk. She put the glass to her lips and started drinking, and drinking, and drinking, until the glass was empty. She put the glass down and let out such a loud belch she was sure her mother could hear it upstairs.
Even after all that food Nikki was still hungry. No wonder since she was always hungry except that one time on her birthday. It seemed a bit long ago. That one time. That was the only time she felt full. A bit of a strange feeling. Like if you can't think about food at that moment. A bit strange for her since food was always on her mind. She was't even sure if she did want to feel it again. It felt good in on way, but it was such a strange feeling for her. Normal other people felt like that every time after they ate.
Nikki let out another small belch wondering if she should ask her mother for more. She knew that no matter how much she ate she would still be hungry for dinner but she just wolfed down a ice cream, chocolate bar and a glass of chocolate milk. She ate it pretty fast. If her mother heard she already finished her treat so fast she might be a bit upset. She closed her eyes while thinking and a few minutes later you could hear a soft snoring together with the sound of the T.V.


"Nikki. It's time to wake up." Linda said.

Nikki's eyes slowly opened and she saw her mother. She yawned again and stretched herself. She looked again at her mother and went sitting up straight with that she again felt a pain in her head. Linda saw the painful look at Nikki's face.

"Does you head still hurt?" She asked concerned.

"Yeah it does." She mumbled looking at her mother like if she was a little, sad girl.

"All right you stay home tomorrow. Maybe also the day after tomorrow. A least until you feel better." Linda said.

Nikki did't say anything. Staying at home two days did't sound so bad. At least Raiza would't tease her for some time. Sure she would miss Denvert, Robbie, Tanja and Rue but it were only two days. They would be okay. But still...

"Mommy. Can you tell my friends I'm fine but I stay home two days. I don't want them to be worried."

"Sure Nikki. No problem." Linda said friendly. "But now it's time for dinner. You're hungry right."

"Always mommy. You know that always. I can't help it. I'm just always hungry. I can't stop it. I would like it if I could stop it. But eating always take away some of my hunger. It also made me fatter. That was one of the fun things about it."

Linda sighed softly. She would never understand what Nikki liked so much about being fat. She was a a slender and fit child when she was young. The complete opposite of Nikki who was the fattest, and most unfit child in class. Why did Nikki liked it so much? She also used to have problems with her parents about music, clothes, boyfriends but that was something all parents had with their kids. Sure there were enough fat kids but normally they wanted to lose their fat. Some of them did't do any effort to get rid of it. They were just sitting on their fat butt while wolfing down a hamburger with fries ans a milkshake thinking how to lose weight. They were lying against themselves but at least they wanted to lose it.

Linda put a lot of spaghetti on Nikki's plate wit a lot of tomato sauce with minced meat and some rasped cheese on top of it. Nikki smiled.

"Oh by the way Nikki before I forget. The day after tomorrow we have a photo shoot. I think it's better if you stay at home that day from school but we can do that photo shoot."

"Yeah!" Nikki cheered before she started to wolf down her spaghetti.

1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.content:
Her eyes slid over the kids stopped for few seconds at Nikki but the obese girl told her that she did't liked moving at all and make her the wolf would seem a bit like teasing, and she wanted the kids to like her. So she looked further.

"How about you eh... Robert?"

A thin, shy looking boy stepped forward. Nikki thought he did't looked much like a wolf at all. But she also knew that the boy probably was fast. She sighed. She guessed she need to play this game anyway. There were so much kids so there was possibility that she would't be caught first.
Nikki and he rest of the kids went to the wall while the boy was standing in he middle of he room.

"All right." Miss Tatcher said. "Begin."

The kids all asked together what time it was. The boy answered: "Five." And all kids did five steps forward.
Well this is't so bad. Nikki thought to herself.

But then suddenly the boy yelled: "Lunchtime!"

All kids started to run away. Nikki also tried to run but she was fast out of breath. She noticed the boy already tagged some of the other kids and some came after her. Nikki tried to run a bit more but was already breathing deeply and waddled to the bench. With a smile she went sitting.

"Hee what's up with her?" A kid asked.

"She's tired. Running is bit hard for her." Miss Tatcher said who went sitting next to Nikki.

"Yeah running is hard or her because she's so super fat!" A girl yelled.

"Raiza I don't want to hear that again from you!" MissTatcher said. "It does't matter how fat or thin a kid is or what skin color he or she has. You just don't tease other kids. Do you understand that?"

"Yes Miss Tatcher." The girl that was called Raiza mumbled before she ran to the others.

"Your mother told me are always hungry, and you also have big appetite."

"Uh-huh." Nikki answered.

"You know I used to be fat too when I was your age. My mother's fault she fed me way to much and way too unhealthy food. But at school I got teased. So much I went on a diet. I lost a lot of weight and they stopped teasing me. Maybe you can do that too."

"But I like being fat! I don't want to lose weight. But I would like it if they stopped teasing."

Miss Tatcher looked surprised she did't expect this answer. She looked back at the other kids.
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.title: Running is hard

choices: Nikki manages to do it, maybe enough to show up Raiza!
She tries, but her tummy just won't let her do it.
1112122121222211211211112211212212111121.content:
Nikki kept watching on from the bench as the kids continued the game. She was happy to have decided to finish early; it was going on on for a while and she'd have been 'eaten' over a dozen times if she went back in.
Truth was, Nikki had regained her energy a good while ago, but the running around the game included made her decide to stay out. Besides, too much exercise was risky; she wanted to stay at her large size and gym class was a major threat to that.
...
Until she recalled what Miss Tatcher said before the game started, when Nikki asked if she had to join in.
Unless you have a doctor's note... the statement replayed in her head.
She glanced at the ceiling and tilted her head in thought. What if she DID have a doctor's note? Could she convince her mother to get one for her?
Doubtful. She wants Nikki to get smaller and she's hardly going to help her butterball of a daughter skip out on exercise.
Unless she was sick or broke her leg or something?
...nah, how would she get sick on purpose? And breaking her leg on purpose just sounds silly, if not painful.


"Okay kids, time for something else!" Miss Tatcher called, causing Nikki to jump off her train of thought. Time really does fly.
Being gym class, she was sceptical to what this new activity was going to be, so she stayed seated till she heard the instructions.
Miss Tatcher, who had taken a mental note of Nikki's hatred for exercise, had a plan B. "Pretty basic, we're going to see how many times you can touch your toes within a minute."
The kids nodded, sounding up for it. Nikki was being swayed, since it sounded like no running was involved.
As Miss Tatcher demonstrated how to properly stretch down and up, Nikki decided to join in, so she slowly raised her heavy self from the bench and waddled over to join her friends.
"Oh, Nikki!" Miss Tatcher smiled at her, her plan had worked, "Decided to join in?"
"Uh-huh," Nikki nodded, a shy little smile on her round face.
Raiza, the girl who had teased her earlier, scoffed quietly and whispered amongst her friends. "This oughta be good."
"Since it'll be easier to keep track, and since I know some of you will say you did more than you actually did..." Miss Tatcher explained while, during her last statement, playfully eyed a girl who just giggled along with some of the others, "we'll take it in turns, and I'll time you."
The kids all nodded, and she organised them to line up against the wall, calling each kid to walk out next to her and begin as she timed them.
Nikki was nervous. She looked down at her huge round belly. She couldn't even see her toes, let alone touch them!
She watched as Raiza took her turn, and eventually Miss Tatcher stopped her stopwatch.
"Thirty-four," she nodded, smiling, "very good!"
Raiza smirked proudly and skipped back in line, muttering and giggling with her friends.
"Alright...Nikki!"
Nikki gulped, slowly waddling out to take Raiza's place beside Miss Tatcher. Her nerves only got worse as she felt the eyes of everyone in the class on her, judging her.

"And, go!"
